segment.source: If your app uses ad mediation or displays banner or video interstitial ads from Microsoft Advertising, use the Monetization Monetize with ads page to manage your use of ads.
segment.target: If your app uses ad mediation or displays banner or video interstitial ads from Microsoft Advertising, use the Monetization Monetize with ads page to manage your use of ads.

segment.source: Monetize with ads
segment.target: Monetize with ads

segment.source: Monetize with ads
segment.target: Monetize with ads

segment.source: If your app uses an AdMediatorControl, AdControl, or InterstitialAd control to display banner or video interstitial ads, use the MonetizationMonetize with ads page to manage your use of ads.
segment.target: If your app uses an AdMediatorControl, AdControl, or InterstitialAd control to display banner or video interstitial ads, use the MonetizationMonetize with ads page to manage your use of ads.

segment.source: Windows ad mediation
segment.target: Windows ad mediation

segment.source: If your app uses ad mediation, use this section to configure your mediation settings and add required parameters for each of the ad networks used by your app.
segment.target: If your app uses ad mediation, use this section to configure your mediation settings and add required parameters for each of the ad networks used by your app.

segment.source: For more information about the options in this section, see Submit your app and configure ad mediation.
segment.target: For more information about the options in this section, see Submit your app and configure ad mediation.

segment.source: Ad mediation lets you optimize your in-app advertising revenue by mediating banner ad requests from multiple ad networks.
segment.target: Ad mediation lets you optimize your in-app advertising revenue by mediating banner ad requests from multiple ad networks.

segment.source: For more information about ad mediation, see Use ad mediation to maximize revenue.
segment.target: For more information about ad mediation, see Use ad mediation to maximize revenue.

segment.source: COPPA compliance
segment.target: COPPA compliance

segment.source: For purposes of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act (“COPPA”), you must notify Microsoft if your app is directed at children under the age of 13.
segment.target: For purposes of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act (“COPPA”), you must notify Microsoft if your app is directed at children under the age of 13.

segment.source: If you use Dev Center to indicate to Microsoft that your app is directed at children under the age of 13, Microsoft will take steps to disable its behavioral advertising services when delivering advertising into your app.
segment.target: If you use Dev Center to indicate to Microsoft that your app is directed at children under the age of 13, Microsoft will take steps to disable its behavioral advertising services when delivering advertising into your app.

segment.source: If your app is directed at children under the age of 13, you have certain obligations under COPPA.
segment.target: If your app is directed at children under the age of 13, you have certain obligations under COPPA.

segment.source: For more information on your obligations under COPPA, please see this page.
segment.target: For more information on your obligations under COPPA, please see this page.

segment.source: Microsoft affiliate ads
segment.target: Microsoft affiliate ads

segment.source: Check the box in this section if you want to show Microsoft affiliate ads in your app.
segment.target: Check the box in this section if you want to show Microsoft affiliate ads in your app.

segment.source: If you check this box, ads for products in the Store, including music, games, movies, apps, hardware and software, will be served to your app when no ads from other ad networks are available.
segment.target: If you check this box, ads for products in the Store, including music, games, movies, apps, hardware and software, will be served to your app when no ads from other ad networks are available.

segment.source: When users click the ads and bus products in the Store within a given attribution window, you will earn a commission on approved purchases.
segment.target: When users click the ads and bus products in the Store within a given attribution window, you will earn a commission on approved purchases.

segment.source: If you change this selection, you do not need to republish your app for the changes to take effect.
segment.target: If you change this selection, you do not need to republish your app for the changes to take effect.

segment.source: For more information about Microsoft affiliate ads, see About affiliate ads.
segment.target: For more information about Microsoft affiliate ads, see About affiliate ads.

segment.source: Note If your app uses ad mediation (that is, it uses an AdMediatorControl to display ads), your app can show affiliate ads only if your ad mediation settings are configured to show ads from Microsoft.
segment.target: Note If your app uses ad mediation (that is, it uses an AdMediatorControl to display ads), your app can show affiliate ads only if your ad mediation settings are configured to show ads from Microsoft.

segment.source: Community ads
segment.target: Community ads

segment.source: Check the box in this section if you want to cross-promote your app with apps from other developers.
segment.target: Check the box in this section if you want to cross-promote your app with apps from other developers.

segment.source: If you check this box and then create a community ad campaign, your app will show ads for apps published by other developers who also create community ad campaigns, and ads for their apps will show in your app.
segment.target: If you check this box and then create a community ad campaign, your app will show ads for apps published by other developers who also create community ad campaigns, and ads for their apps will show in your app.

segment.source: Community ads are free, and they are shown only when no ads from other ad networks are available.
segment.target: Community ads are free, and they are shown only when no ads from other ad networks are available.

segment.source: If you change this selection, you do not need to republish your app for the changes to take effect.
segment.target: If you change this selection, you do not need to republish your app for the changes to take effect.

segment.source: For more information about community ads, see About community ads.
segment.target: For more information about community ads, see About community ads.

segment.source: Microsoft Advertising ad units
segment.target: Microsoft Advertising ad units

segment.source: Use this section to create a Microsoft Advertising ad unit.
segment.target: Use this section to create a Microsoft Advertising ad unit.

segment.source: You only need to create ad units in the following scenarios:
segment.target: You only need to create ad units in the following scenarios:

segment.source: Your app shows banner ads from Microsoft Advertising by using an AdControl object.
segment.target: Your app shows banner ads from Microsoft Advertising by using an AdControl object.

segment.source: Your app shows video interstitial ads from Microsoft Advertising by using an InterstitialAd object.
segment.target: Your app shows video interstitial ads from Microsoft Advertising by using an InterstitialAd object.

segment.source: To create an ad unit for these scenarios:
segment.target: To create an ad unit for these scenarios:

segment.source: Name the ad unit.
segment.target: Name the ad unit.

segment.source: Select the ad unit type (Banner or Video interstitial).
segment.target: Select the ad unit type (Banner or Video interstitial).

segment.source: Select the device type (Mobile or PC/Tablet).
segment.target: Select the device type (Mobile or PC/Tablet).

segment.source: Click Create ad unit.
segment.target: Click Create ad unit.

segment.source: Your ad units appear in a table at the bottom of this section.
segment.target: Your ad units appear in a table at the bottom of this section.

segment.source: For each ad unit you will see an Application ID and an Ad unit ID.
segment.target: For each ad unit you will see an Application ID and an Ad unit ID.

segment.source: To show ads in your app, you'll need to use these values in your code:
segment.target: To show ads in your app, you'll need to use these values in your code:

segment.source: If your app shows banner ads, assign these values to the ApplicationId and AdUnitId properties of your AdControl object.
segment.target: If your app shows banner ads, assign these values to the ApplicationId and AdUnitId properties of your AdControl object.

segment.source: If your app shows video interstitial ads, pass these values to the RequestAd method of your InterstitialAd object.
segment.target: If your app shows video interstitial ads, pass these values to the RequestAd method of your InterstitialAd object.

segment.source: Note If your app uses ad mediation to show banner ads from Microsoft Advertising (that is, it uses an AdMediatorControl object), you do not need to request ad units.
segment.target: Note If your app uses ad mediation to show banner ads from Microsoft Advertising (that is, it uses an AdMediatorControl object), you do not need to request ad units.

segment.source: In this scenario, Microsoft Advertising ad units are automatically generated for you.
segment.target: In this scenario, Microsoft Advertising ad units are automatically generated for you.
